yubu.title: SaaS solution for high school student's study choice process
yubu.content:
In 2008 I launched the first version of StudieID which, after that company merged with BeInvolved, became to be Yubu in 2012. After a significant market penetration our competitor decided to rather buy us out. After a year long process of handing the company over I closed the chapter.
In this 12 year process I learned valuable lessons for every stage of a company. From the early start-up days to the growth fase to eventually your exit. During this project I got to learn from some of the best in the fields. I got code-tutored by `We Are Builders` (a successfull start-up studio from Rotterdam). During our investment rounds and during the selling of my business I got to learn from some experienced investors which gave me insight in some higher level business-strategies. All in all, the time spent working on Yubu made me the business savvy programmer I am today.

skillset.title: But... but... how?
skillset.subtitle: Shortlist of used software and technical skills
skillset.content: Even though my biggest strength is my cross-domain experience and knowledge, I thought it is important to give an overview of my technical skills. In no way is belowmentioned list exhausting but most important skills are shown. Click on a skill for a more elaborate description.

android.name: Android
android.description: If you ask me... Apple or Google? You will get a definite answer in a split second. To each his own, but for me it's Google.

chrome.name: Chrome
chrome.description: Simply can't live without it. Dev tools is essential for most developers.

composer.name: Composer
composer.description: Simply can't live without it. Composer looks after all of my php-packages for me.

css.name: Css
css.description: When it comes to CSS I like to write CSS-only components. I find it a challenge to keep things as clean and lightweight as possible.

docker.name: Docker
docker.description: With Docker you can run projects on your local machine almost identical to what you actually host in the web. This way 'it works on my machine so it should work' almost becomes a reasonable thing to say.

git.name: Git
git.description: In programming it's important to realise the immense amount of work others have done to make possible what we build now. Let us thank Linus Torvalds for creating GIT.

github.name: Github
github.description: My choice at this moment when it comes down to version control for my personal projects. I love how GitHub works together with the deployment service 'Travis'.

html5.name: Html5
html5.description: Writing readable and understandable code is important, and html5 simplifies that. No reason not to love it.

javascript.name: Javascript
javascript.description: The web wouldn't exist without it nowadays. My framework of choice is Vue. Though I also like to explore other frameworks from time to time.

laravel.name: Laravel
laravel.description: Simple yet effective back-end framework based on PHP. I have worked with it for 5+ years now and loved every minute of it.

linux.name: Linux
linux.description: This is my operation system of choice. You can say it's better, or faster, or more flexible... But to me it just comes down to 'more fun' then windows.

mysql.name: Mysql
mysql.description: Even though I would never use MySQL in a new project anymore, but plenty existing projects are still run by MySQL. If you consider that you learn from making mistakes... I've learnt basically everything about MySQL.

nodejs.name: Nodejs
nodejs.description: What is there to say... Can't live without it. Node does the heavy javscript lifting.

php.name: Php
php.description: You either love this back-end programming language or you hate it. After more then 15 years of getting to know all of it's little quirks and strange behaviours sometimes you can guess which side I am on. My favorite framework is Laravel but I do like to explore other frameworks from time to time.

phpstorm.name: Phpstorm
phpstorm.description: PhpStorm has been my IDE for years and it does not keep many secrets for me.

postgresql.name: Postgresql
postgresql.description: MySQL used to be my weapon of choice because the strictness that comes with Postgres did not appeal to me at first. Now I would not want anything else.

postman.name: Postman
postman.description: Can not work without Postman when developing and testing API's. It has saved me important hours in the past and will continue to do so.

stack.name: Stack
stack.description: What to say about stack-overflow. Whenever SO is down, I rather go get myself a cup of coffee. Or two...

vue.name: Vue
vue.description: Vue is a front-end framework that works really well with Laravel. Worked with it most of my time at Yubu which means I have 5+ years of experience with it.
